--- title: "PDF Slides with beamer" author: "R Workshop" format: beamer theme: Madrid urlcolor: blue # The packages and options below are required # to make kableExtra tables work # You can delete them if you are not using the package header-includes: - \usepackage{booktabs} - \usepackage{longtable} - \usepackage{array} - \usepackage{multirow} - \usepackage{wrapfig} - \usepackage{float} - \usepackage{colortbl} - \usepackage{pdflscape} - \usepackage{tabu} - \usepackage{threeparttable} - \usepackage{threeparttablex} - \usepackage[normalem]{ulem} - \usepackage{makecell} - \usepackage{xcolor} - \newcommand{\theHtable}{\thetable} --- ## About Beamer - Quarto uses Beamer to create PDF presentations - Similar to [LaTeX Beamer](https://www.overleaf.com/learn/latex/Beamer_Presentations%3A_A_Tutorial_for_Beginners_(Part_1)â€”Getting_Started) but using Markdown language - See [here](https://quarto.org/docs/presentations/beamer.html) for more information - And [here](https://latex-beamer.com/tutorials/beamer-themes/) for themes ## Code Our code chunk settings make it so that code is hidden from the pdf by default. We can override this with [code chunk options](https://quarto.org/docs/computations/execution-options.html). For example, here I am forcing the code to appear in the pdf. ```{.r .cell-code} 1+1 ``` [1] 2 ## R Figures ![An example of how to make figures using `ggplot2`](pdf_slides_files/figure-html/fig-penguins-1.png){#fig-penguins width=80%} ## External figures ::: {#fig-import} ![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nrennie/nrennie.rbind.io/main/content/blog/2024-01-31-making-pdf-with-quarto-typst-latex/featured.png){fig-align="center" width=50%} An example of how to plot an external figure ::: ## Pipe tables | Default | Left | Right | Center | |---------|:-----|------:|:------:| | 12 | 12 | 12 | 12 | | 123 | 123 | 123 | 123 | | 1 | 1 | 1 | 1 | : Demonstration of pipe table syntax ## R Tables We will use the [`kableExtra`](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/kableExtra/vignettes/awesome_table_in_pdf.pdf) package because `tinytable` faces issues with Beamer. ::: {#tbl-tidy .cell tbl-cap='An example of a table made from tidy data with `tinytable`'} `````{=html}
